Topic.Title: How to edit a published WIP game?

Posts.EditableText:
I have a problem. When i want to edit my published games i press on Create, and go on Edit. The quest game doesn't show. It shows in the published games, and i can't edit it, even though i made it as a WIP. What do i do?

A person asked for more details, i really hope this helps more.
Posts.HTML:
I have a problem. When i want to edit my published games i press on Create, and go on Edit. The quest game doesn't show. It shows in the published games, and i can't edit it, even though i made it as a WIP. What do i do?

A person asked for more details, i really hope this helps more.

Posts.EditableText:
Is there not a "View/edit game listing" link beside it?
Does the link not work?

If you created it using the desktop editor and uploaded it, that should give you an option to upload a new version.
If you created it using the web editor, it should be listed in the "Edit" list as well as the "Published" list.
Posts.HTML:
Is there not a "View/edit game listing" link beside it?
Does the link not work?

If you created it using the desktop editor and uploaded it, that should give you an option to upload a new version.
If you created it using the web editor, it should be listed in the "Edit" list as well as the "Published" list.

Posts.EditableText: There is, but i dont understand how to update the script. I use the web on a laptop
Posts.HTML: There is, but i dont understand how to update the script. I use the web on a laptop

Posts.EditableText: OK, if you're using the web editor, you need to find the game on the editing list. Like this: That should allow you to edit the game. If the game isn't on that list, then the site only has the compiled game, not the original ASLX file. You won't be able to use the web editor.
Posts.HTML:
OK, if you're using the web editor, you need to find the game on the editing list. Like this:

That should allow you to edit the game.

If the game isn't on that list, then the site only has the compiled game, not the original ASLX file. You won't be able to use the web editor.
